title: PPPOE CLIENT INTERFACE CONFIGURATION COMMAND
description: This command allows the operator to configure PPPoE client interface parameters.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with pppoe privileges, and executed by 
operators with pppoe privileges.
syntax: > configure pppoe-client ( no interface (ifindex) client-id <PPPoE::ClientId> ) | ( interface (ifindex) client-id <PPPoE::ClientId> profile-name <PPPoE::PppProfileName> username <PPPoE::UserName> password <PPPoE::Password> [ no mac | mac <PPPoE::MacAddress> ] [ no pbit | pbit <PPPoE::PbitValue> ] )

resource_parameters.name: (ifindex)
resource_parameters.description: interface index of the PPPoE client port

command_parameters.name: profile-name
values: name                  : enter profile name to be associated Field type <PPPoE::IgnoredPppProfileName>

command_parameters.name: username
command_parameters.description: user name for PPP authentication mandatory parameter - user name string - length: x<=25

command_parameters.name: password
command_parameters.description: password for PPP authentication mandatory parameter - password string hidden from users - length: x<=25

command_parameters.name: [no] mac
command_parameters.description: specify the client MAC address for PPPoE frame optional parameter with default value: "00 : 00 : 00 : 00 : 00 : 00" - a unicast mac-address (example : 00:01:02:03:04:05) - length: 6

command_parameters.name: [no] pbit
command_parameters.description: the Pbit value for PPPoE frame optional parameter with default value: 0 - the Pbit value - range: [0...7]

raw:
help configure pppoe-client interface
PPPOE CLIENT INTERFACE CONFIGURATION COMMAND
============================================

Command Description
-------------------

This command allows the operator to configure PPPoE client interface parameters.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with pppoe privileges, and executed by 
operators with pppoe privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure pppoe-client ( no interface (ifindex) client-id <PPPoE::ClientId> ) 
| ( interface (ifindex) client-id <PPPoE::ClientId> profile-name 
<PPPoE::PppProfileName> username <PPPoE::UserName> password <PPPoE::Password> [ 
no mac | mac <PPPoE::MacAddress> ] [ no pbit | pbit <PPPoE::PbitValue> ] )

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "PPPoE Client Interface Configuration Command" Resource Parameters

Resource Identifier        Description

(ifindex)                  interface index of the PPPoE client port
client-id                  the PPPoE client id

Table "PPPoE Client Interface Configuration Command" Command Parameters

Parameter                  Description

profile-name               PPP profile name
                           mandatory parameter

                           Parameter type: <PPPoE::PppProfileName>
                           Format:
                           name : <PPPoE::IgnoredPppProfileName>
                           Possible values:
                           - name                  : enter profile name to be 
associated 
                           Field type <PPPoE::IgnoredPppProfileName>
                           - name of the PPP profile
                           - length: 1<=x<=64 

username                   user name for PPP authentication
                           mandatory parameter

                           Parameter type: <PPPoE::UserName>
                           Format:
                           - user name string
                           - length: x<=25 

password                   password for PPP authentication
                           mandatory parameter

                           Parameter type: <PPPoE::Password>
                           Format:
                           - password string hidden from users
                           - length: x<=25 

[no] mac                   specify the client MAC address for PPPoE frame
                           optional parameter with default value: "00 : 00 : 00 
: 00 : 00 : 00"

                           Parameter type: <PPPoE::MacAddress>
                           Format:
                           - a unicast mac-address (example : 00:01:02:03:04:05)
                           - length: 6 

[no] pbit                  the Pbit value for PPPoE frame
                           optional parameter with default value: 0

                           Parameter type: <PPPoE::PbitValue>
                           Format:
                           - the Pbit value
                           - range: [0...7]


DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#
